isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - INSTALL - INSTALL HOOD SEALS

svcsubproc.title: Install Cowl Hood Seal on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Check cowl hood seal (Item 1) for cracks and tears. If damaged, replace it.

With the hood tilted open, position cowl hood seal (Item 1) over cowl tray (Item 2) with hood seal mounting groove positioned over the cowl tray flange and push cowl hood seal firmly down onto cowl tray flange.
Close hood and fasten latches on both sides of hood.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cowl Hood Seal on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Check cowl hood seal (Item 1) for cracks and tears. If damaged, replace it.

With the hood tilted open, position cowl hood seal (Item 1) over cowl tray (Item 2) with hood seal mounting groove positioned over the cowl tray flange (Item 3) and push cowl hood seal firmly down onto cowl tray flange.

svcsubproc.title: Install Radiator Shell Hood Seals on 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Check radiator shell hood seals (Item 4) and seal pads (Items 8 and 11) for cracks and tears. If damaged, replace them.

Position driver or passenger side radiator shell hood seal (Item 4) on the radiator shell flange (Item 5) and secure by aligning push-in fasteners starting with the first hole next to the front hinge bracket (Item 12). Push the push-in fasteners through the radiator shell flange; use a small hammer and tap each fastener to ensure the seal stays secured. NOTE that the fourth and fifth holes (Item 14, circle A) and first and second holes (Item 15, circle B) from the top of radiator shell side seam will not be used. These holes are used while installing seal pad bracket with seal pad (Items 7 and 8, view in circle A) and (Items 10 and 11, view in circle B) . Repeat procedure to install the other radiator shell hood seal.

If it is necessary to replace the seal pad (Item 8, view in circle A) on the seal pad bracket (Item 7, view in circle A) or seal pad (Item 11, view in circle B) on the seal pad bracket (Item 10, view in circle B), remove two push-in fasteners (Item 13, view in circle A and circle B) and remove it from seal pad bracket (Item 7, view in circle A) or (Item 10, view in circle B). Save push-in fasteners for installation, if not damaged.

If seal pad (Item 8, view in circle A) or seal pad (Item 11, view in circle B) was removed from the seal pad bracket (Item 7, view in circle A) or (Item 10, view in circle B), position new seal pad on the seal pad bracket and install two push-in fasteners (Item 13, view in circle A and circle B) to secure it to the seal pad bracket.

Check to see that the speed nuts are not damaged and in the proper position on the seal pad brackets (Item 7). Position seal pad bracket with seal pad (Items 7 and 8, view in circle A) under the top of the radiator shell flange (Item 5), and align holes in seal pad bracket (Item 7) with fourth and fifth holes (Item 14, circle A) from front hinge bracket (Item 12). Install two sheet metal screws with flat washers (Item 6) through the hood seal (Item 4), radiator shell flange (Item 5) and seal pad bracket (Item 7) into the speed nuts on the seal pad bracket and tighten, driver side shown. Repeat for passenger side.

Check to see that the speed nuts are not damaged and in the proper position on the seal pad bracket (Item 10). Position seal pad bracket with seal pad (Items 10 and 11, view in circle B) on the inside of the radiator shell flange (Item 5), and align holes in seal pad bracket (Item 10) with first and second holes (Item 15, view in circle B) from the top of radiator shell side seam. Install two sheet metal screws with flat washers (Item 9) through the hood seal (Item 4), radiator shell flange (Item 5) and seal pad bracket (Item 10) into the speed nuts on the seal pad bracket and tighten, driver side shown. Repeat for passenger side.
Close right or left side hoods and fasten both latches on each hood as required.
